item.title: Astral
item.description: - Astral announces itself as a new company that seeks to make the Python ecosystem more productive by developing high-performance developer tools, starting with Ruff.

item.title: Clock
item.description: - The Clock project is a new way of representing time that has been designed to make time feel more natural and personal.

item.title: Software firms across US facing tax bills that threaten survival
item.description: - Software startups are facing huge income tax bills, rising up to 400%, due to a change in US tax law related to research and development costs.

item.title: Making friends as an adult is hard (2021)
item.description: - Making friends as an adult can be challenging due to a lack of organic social environments that promote continuous unplanned interaction and shared vulnerability.

item.title: Marginalia: DIY search engine that focuses on non-commercial content
item.description: - Marginalia is an independent DIY search engine that focuses on non-commercial content and custom-built software.

item.title: An example of LLM prompting for programming
item.description: - Xu Hao, Head of Technology in China for Thoughtworks, uses ChatGPT to generate self-testing code using "generated knowledge" and "chain of thought prompting" techniques.

item.title: Why don't more people live close to friends?
item.description: - Living close to close friends, not just family, can make people happier according to a recent article in The Atlantic.

item.title: Firefox may soon reject Cookie prompts automatically
item.description: - Firefox, a popular web browser, is considering an update that would automatically reject cookie prompts.

item.title: Microsoft plugging more ads into Windows 11 Start Menu
item.description: - Microsoft is adding more ads into the Windows 11 Start Menu, prompting mixed reactions from users.

item.title: Why do ships use "port" & "starboard" instead of "left" & "right?"
item.description: - Ships use "port" and "starboard" instead of "left" and "right" to avoid confusion, as they refer to fixed locations on a vessel.

item.title: Netflix will end its DVD service after 25 years
item.description: - Netflix will be ending its DVD service after 25 years that helped the company become a behemoth in Hollywood - Netflix's DVD service involved sending movies through the mail, in recognizable red-and-white envelopes - Ted Sarandos, Netflix's co-chief executive, credited the service's iconic red envelopes for changing the way people watched shows and movies at home - The service's end comes after distributing 5.2 billion discs.

item.title: Changes to Tailscale Pricing & Plans
item.description: - Tailscale introduces new pricing and plans, expanding its free plan to three users and implementing usage-based billing for monthly paid plans.

item.title: A WWII spy who hid codes in her knitting
item.description: - No meaningful content was found in the post.

item.title: Heroku has been running a second copy of my scheduler instance
item.description: - MusicButler web-app experienced a bug where tasks were dispatched twice caused by Heroku's celerybeat dyno.

item.title: French publisher arrested in London for refusal to tell police his passcodes
item.description: - French publisher, Ernest Moret, has been arrested on terrorism charges in London after being questioned about his participation in anti-government protests in France.
